title.val: Growing Plants, Growing Community: Tour & Talk with Planting Justice

location: Sign in to download the location
description:
Join us for a tour, talk & Q&A session with employees of Planting Justice, an East-Oakland based non-profit and urban farm that provides sustainable living-wage jobs, food access, and holistic programming for communities impacted by mass incarceration. 

This will be an opportunity for attendees to hear how Planting Justice prioritizes and supports formerly incarcerated and system-impacted people while successfully running an organic nursery, 4-acre propagation orchard, Food Sovereignty Youth Leadership program, and expanding into a pay-as-you-can cafe, and 3-acre Aquaponics Farm & Training Center. In addition, Planting Justice is in the process of transferring ownership of its nursery land to the local Ohlone community, through the indigenous women-owned Sogorea Te‚Äô Land Trust, and can talk through that process with us.

If you're curious about urban farming, combatting food apartheid, non-traditional business models like pay-as-you-can, workforce re-entry programs, the indigenous land-back movement, or generally getting involved with a cool food non-profit, this event is for you!

The $5 cost to attend will secure your spot and be donated directly to Planting Justice.

*Note, there may also be an opportunity to volunteer after the talk and get our hands dirty on the farm, details forthcoming*
---

Story Salon is a cherished student tradition that builds warmth and connection amongst our Haas Full-time MBA community through vulnerable storytelling. By sharing their unique stories, our community can learn something new about the speakers, feel more connected to them, and engage together in topics not usually addressed in the classroom. This shared experience ultimately strengthens our community's sense of common bond and connection with each other.

Note: The actual event starts at 6:10pm. Come early to chat with classmates and enjoy snacks on the balcony. Also please note that this event is capped. When you register for this event, you are committing to attending and taking a spot away from a fellow classmate so please be mindful - if something comes up and you can no longer attend, please unregister from this event so another student can have a spot!

location: Wells Fargo C420, Chiet Hall, Haas School of Business, 2220 Piedmont Avenue, S430, Berkeley, CA 94720, United States
description:
Is shareholder primacy compatible with addressing existential threats to humanity such as climate change?

Shareholder primacy has dominated corporate governance for half a century. Can it address existential threats like climate change‚Äîor does it accelerate them? Hosted by the new Beyond Capitalism Club, Haas Finance Club, and the Center for Responsible Business, this in-person debate will draw on expertise from across the campus and beyond. We invite your curiosity to question and openness to learn about the tenets of our current economic structure.

Lunch will be provided. Please also register on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/beyond-capitalism-debate-series-tickets-1972831930411?aff=oddtdtcreator

Debaters:

Adam Sterling

Associate Dean of Executive Education and Strategic Partnerships at Stanford Law School

Haas & Berkeley Law alum



Susan Mac Cormac Taylor

Morrison & Foerster, Partner and co-chair of Energy and Clean Technology Group & Social Enterprise and Impact Investing Group

Lecturer at Berkeley Law School



Moderator:

Ernesto Dal Bo

Phillips Girgich Professor of Business at Berkeley-Haas

Business & Public Policy | Sustainability
---

location: Sign in to download the location
description:
We‚Äôre excited to host Brian Wolfe for a virtual ETA event.

Brian is the Managing Partner of Funded Ventures, a retired partner at Kirkland & Ellis, and teaches private equity at Chicago Booth and Northwestern Law.

Before Funded Ventures, Brian co-led a SaaS buy-and-build strategy, where he and his partner acquired three SaaS businesses beginning in 2017, executed a roll-up and operational improvement plan, and ultimately sold the combined platform to Alpine Investors. 

Brian will cover:
	‚Ä¢	Lessons from his SaaS roll-up and operator journey
	‚Ä¢	How searchers can build durable careers through ETA

title.val: Haas Education Club: Economist Judd Kessler book talk

location: C230, 2220 Piedmont Avenue, S430, Berkeley, CA 94720, United States
description:
Wharton professor and economist Judd Kessler will be giving a talk on his new book, Lucky by Design, on Wednesday, December 3, from 2:30‚Äì3:30 PM. The first 100 attendees will each receive a free copy of the book!

Judd is an experimental economist who conducts research in the fields of market design, public economics, and labor economics. Applications include school choice, job allocation, organ donation, and charitable giving. Judd is a world expert on summer youth employment programs, their impact on youth outcomes, and how they can be improved. He also conducts research on gender differences that might impact labor market outcomes and on discrimination in labor markets.

RSVP here: https://wharton.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_50e4G69dlozPi3Y

title.val: Entrepreneurship in Brewing: Dan Gordon on the History of Gordon Biersch

location: C125, Beer Industry Club, UC Berkeley, Haas School of Business, 545 Student Services Bldg., #1900, Berkeley, CA 94720,
description:
Dan Gordon is coming to campus to talk about what it's like to start a business in an industry 20 years before it was cool. Over the past few decades, Dan has seen a complete transformation in the brewing industry and has learned a lot about entrepreneurship along the way. Come for some free beer and learn from someone that's experienced it all in entrepreneurship.

About Gordon Biersch:

Gordon Biersch Brewery was founded by Dan Gordon and Dean Biersch. Gordon, a graduate from the five-year brewing engineering program at Weihenstephan, Germany, and Biersch opened their first brewery restaurant in Palo Alto, California in July 1988. In 1999, the restaurants were sold to what ultimately became CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries. In November 1995, the two founders and their original investors, wanting to expand their then $20-million business, accepted a $11.2 million investment from the Fertitta family of Las Vegas. Since 1998, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company has more than doubled its production, increasing its capacity to 3.1 million gallons of beer annually, making Gordon Biersch Brewing Company one of the largest breweries in the San Francisco Bay Area and giving it a national reputation.

title.val: HHA x F@H Food As Medicine Speaker Series & Mixer

location: Chou N100, 2220 Piedmont Avenue, S430, Berkeley, CA 94720, United States
description:
Join the Haas Healthcare Association and Food@Haas for a special collab on HHA‚Äôs final speakers series covering Food as Medicine!!

Food as Medicine is a rapidly expanding holistic approach to healthcare that emphasizes the use of food as a therapeutic tool to prevent, manage, and treat diseases--highlighting the very real impact of our diets on our overall health and wellness. 

We have a incredible lineup of speakers, including: 
Pam Schwartz, MPH - Food as Medicine Director at Kaiser Permanente 
Christine Hamann - Director of Product at NourishedRx
Steven Chen, MD - Chief Medical Officer at Recipe for Health, 

The panel will be followed by an HHA x F@H mixer to connect and celebrate the intersection of food and health. And of course, there will be yummy eats!

title.val: Beyond the Buzzwords: A Live Q&A on the Future of DEI

location: Sign in to download the location
description:
You've heard the podcast‚Äînow you can join the conversation! Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) is more than just corporate jargon; it's a strategic necessity facing growing scrutiny.

Join the Race and Inclusion Initiative (RII) production crew and featured staff/faculty experts from the podcast for a live, candid Q&A session. We'll cut through the noise, challenge common myths, explore the intersectional challenges discussed this season, and collectively reimagine the future of DEI in Haas and beyond the business school. This is your chance to bring your toughest questions and engage directly with the voices behind the series to center our conversation on how to move forward with DEI student initiatives.

Don't just listen‚Äîparticipate. Your voice, experiences, and opinions are at the core of our defining leadership principle: Students Always.
---
Event Details: https://haas.campusgroups.com/rsvp?id=2251002

title.val: Show & Tell: Stories Behind What We Hold Close

location: Sign in to download the location
description:
Behind every keepsake is a Haas-worthy tale

We all come to the MBA for learning and career growth, and along the way we make so many new friends. But often, even with all the social events and conversations, we‚Äôre still left craving something deeper - connections with people who truly know us. The kind of connections where we truly see a person‚Äôs motivations, the challenges they have overcome, and the pivotal moments that have shaped their journey.

That‚Äôs the spirit behind bringing you: Show & Tell: Stories Behind What We Hold Close.

We all carry a photo, object, or keepsake that means more than meets the eye. In this session, each of us will bring one photo or object that holds personal meaning and share the story behind it. Think of it as a chance to give your classmates a small sneak peek into your world - what shaped you, what you value, or what makes you, you.

Bring something that matters to you, and let‚Äôs learn a little more about each other through the stories we carry

Please fill this google form if you're interested to join: 
https://docs.google.com/forms/u/2/d/e/1FAIpQLSfCI798pt5_KSe1z_LHTjvP2N_iHkDiEoAVPc45yiE40YDSEw/viewform

P.S. The session will be capped to 15 people so please sign up only if you can join.

Ping Jhalak Agarwal or Kureem Nugent with Questions!
---

location: Spieker Forum, Chou Hall Floor 6, Berkeley, CA United States
description:
Story Salon is a cherished student tradition that builds warmth and connection amongst our Haas Full-time MBA community through vulnerable storytelling. Student Speakers are empowered and uplifted to unveil prepared personal stories of their lived experiences. By sharing their unique stories, our community can learn something new about the speakers, feel more connected to them, and engage together in topics not usually addressed in the classroom. This shared experience ultimately strengthens our community's sense of common bond and connection with each other.

Note: The actual event starts at 6:10pm. Come early to chat with classmates and enjoy snacks on the balcony. Also please note that this event is capped. description:
If you‚Äôre still coming down from the high of the BFFF Summit (we definitely are!), we‚Äôd love to invite you to one final gathering to close out the year together.

Berkeley Female Founders & Funders is co-hosting our Holiday Party with Oasis Collective on December 12 in San Francisco, and we‚Äôd be so happy to see you there.

This celebration brings together women and allies in AI, founders, builders, operators, and supporters who believe in community, collaboration, and uplifting one another. It‚Äôs a relaxed, festive space to connect with people shaping the future of tech ‚Äî and doing it with intention and heart.

What the night will include:
‚Ä¢ A welcoming, festive atmosphere
‚Ä¢ Hors d‚Äôoeuvres + two drink tickets
‚Ä¢ An inspiring crowd across AI, tech, and entrepreneurship
‚Ä¢ Genuine, energizing conversation

A huge thank you to our sponsors Kiso Technology and Human Interest for supporting this gathering.

The holidays are all about warmth and connection ‚Äî we can‚Äôt wait to celebrate with this incredible community. ‚ú®

Warmly,
BFFF Team

Snowsports 101 is your crash course in how to actually enjoy a day on the mountain. We will walk through the basics you need before heading to G.N.A.R., including what to wear (and why skiing in jeans is a terrible idea), how to stay safe, and how not to become the story people tell on the chairlift. Whether you are brand new to skiing or riding or just need a preseason refresher, this session will get you ready for winter. And yes, there will be pizza!

What We Will Cover
‚Ä¢ How to drive safely in snow and winter road conditions
‚Ä¢ What gear to rent and what gear is worth buying
‚Ä¢ What to do if not skiing/snow boarding
‚Ä¢ Clothing essentials and layering fundamentals
‚Ä¢ How to choose terrain that matches your comfort level
‚Ä¢ Mountain etiquette and common first timer pitfalls

location: Spieker Forum, 6th Floor, Chou Hall, Haas School of Business, 2220 Piedmont Avenue, S430, Berkeley, CA 94720, United States
description:
Join the Africa Business Club at the UC Berkeley Haas School of Business for the 2026 Haas Africa Business Forum, a flagship gathering convening founders, investors, policymakers, and global leaders to examine Africa‚Äôs evolving business landscape. This year‚Äôs theme, ‚ÄúPolicy, Innovation, and Infrastructure: Shaping a Sustainable Future for African Entrepreneurship,‚Äù explores how enabling regulation, technological advancement, and foundational infrastructure can unlock scalable, inclusive growth across the continent.

The Forum will feature distinguished speakers from across Africa and the global diaspora, offering perspectives across sectors including finance, technology, infrastructure development, public policy, and venture capital.
Through keynote addresses, fireside chats, and panel discussions, participants will engage in forward-looking conversations on how Africa can build resilient institutions, attract long-term capital, and translate innovation into sustainable economic impact.
Event Details
Date: Friday, February 6, 2026
Time: 9:00 a.m. ‚Äì 4:00 p.m. PT
Location: Spieker Forum, Chou Hall, UC Berkeley Haas School of Business
Audience: Open to UC Berkeley students, faculty, staff, alumni, the broader Bay Area community, and members of the general public

Sponsors
FTMBA Program Office (Haas School of Business), McKinsey & Company, Cleva (YC W24), Center for African Studies, UCB Graduate Assembly, African Entrepreneurs at Berkeley

Additional Information
For event-specific questions or partnership inquiries, please contact:
Haas Africa Business Club
üìß Africabusinessclub@berkeley.edu

Event is ADA accessible. For disability accommodation requests and information, please contact Disability Access Services by phone at 510.643.6456 (voice) or 510.642.6376 (TTY) or by email at accessibility@berkeley.edu.
Dress Code: Business Casual

location: Palisades Tahoe We'll carpool from Palisades to Tahoe Dave's for snowshoe rentals, then head to the trailhead.
description:
Not skiing at GNAR? Come join us for snowshoeing instead! This is a great way to enjoy the beauty of the area, and no skis or experience needed. You'll be back in time for the Apr√®s party at 5pm!

We'll trek through snowy trails with stunning mountain views on a moderate 4-mile route, with the option to shorten to 2 miles. This activity is suitable for anyone with basic fitness, if you can go on a hike, you can snowshoe! We'll move at a relaxed pace with breaks as needed. We‚Äôll plan a stop at Tahoe Dave‚Äôs to rent snowshoes before heading to the trail. 

What is snowshoeing? Snowshoeing is like hiking on snow, special wide footwear distributes your weight so you can walk on top of deep snow instead of sinking in. 

LOGISTICS:
Meet at Palisades Tahoe at 11:00 AM
Carpool to Tahoe Dave's to rent snowshoes (or bring your own from Sports Basement if you prefer to rent in advance)
Duration: 3-4 hours total
Trail: Approximately 4 miles with option to shorten to 2 miles
Difficulty: Moderate ‚Äì basic fitness level recommended

WHAT TO BRING:
Warm, waterproof clothing and layers
Winter boots
Water and snacks
Sunscreen and sunglasses

location: Spieker Forum, Berkeley, CA United States
description:
Join us as we celebrate Black History Month by honoring the Bay Area as home‚Äîpast, present, and future. The Bay has long been a gathering place for Black culture, creativity, movement, and community, shaped by many histories and lived experiences.

This event is a showcase of what home in the Bay feels like: music that moves us, food that brings us together, games that spark connection, and shared joy across generations and backgrounds. From live performances to classic game tables and a closing line dance, we invite you to experience the rhythms that make Black culture in the Bay so vibrant.

Whether you‚Äôre a current student or a prospective admit, come feel the roots that make Haas‚Äîand the Bay‚Äîhome.

‚ú® Open to all MBA students.‚ú®

location: Lake Shasta
description:
Each year, the Haas fleet gathers for one of the school‚Äôs most beloved traditions ‚Äî a long weekend where 300+ FTMBA students and partners set sail for the calm blue waters of Lake Shasta. From Friday, May 15 to Monday, May 18, 2026, dozens of houseboats transform into a floating village: part adventure outpost, part summer-camp fever dream, part community retreat.

It‚Äôs simple, it‚Äôs scenic, it‚Äôs slightly chaotic in the best way ‚Äî and it‚Äôs widely known as the signature Haas tradition for a reason. Join us as we cast off for another unforgettable voyage.

This deposit is NON-REFUNDABLE, but you will be allowed to transfer your ticket to someone else prior the transfer deadline.

This deposit IS NOT THE FULL TICKET PRICE but will reserve your place on the trip.

Please visit the Notion Page for more information:

location: Spark Social (601 Mission Bay Blvd. North San Francisco, CA 94158)
description:
Please join the Haas Healthcare Association for a Fall mixer at Spark Social in San Francisco on Thursday, November 13, 4:00-8:00 PM. üçπThis is a great opportunity to make new connections and catch up with fellow alumni and students. Stop by after work or class for a drink + food - plus engaging healthcare discussion! 

Note: HHA members can receive up to $20 in parking reimbursement for city parking when carpooling with three or more attendees (driver + at least two others). title.val: Volunteering at Oakland Chinatown Grocery Delivery

location: Hotel Oakland (273 13th Street, Oakland, CA).
description:
Volunteer Opportunity. Meet @ Hotel Oakland around 1025am on Sat Nov 15th. We work with other volunteers to deliver groceries to elderly folks. If you know mandarin or cantonese that is a bonus as most of the elderly folks here don't speak english. It's not a requirement though -- I learned some while there last year! :) Please get own transportation there (Bart/Bus is easy). Ping Tess Nogles with any questions @ 610-241-4640.

location: Crybaby Nightclub, 1928 Telegraph Ave, Oakland, CA 94612, United States
description:
Everybody's favorite cohort competition is back: Drag Race! This is Q @ Haas' annual fundraiser and everyone's chance to show their moves, makeup, and fashion. We'll have performances from each cohort and even some special guests! Besides drag, we'll have some of our favorite DJ's spinning to keep the vibes up late into the night. We'll also have an open bar (first-come, first-serve) to help ease those performance nerves a bit. You don't have to be a member of Q @ Haas to participate, everyone's invited - including partners!

Each cohort will get its time to shine but only one can take the crown. Will it be yours? 

Doors open at 8pm!
